subject: RE: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Licensing for Jerome and Ghoti fonts
msgSnippet: ... If you re finding FCP cumbersome, be glad you haven t tried others. :) I ve tried FontLab, and it makes FCP look very simple. I n not familiar with
messageBody:
On 8/3/2002 at 3:23 PM Ed Gaddy wrote:
>Hi Wonder,
>
>Fonts are made with software. There are several programs available to do
>it. I use one called Font Creator Program or FCP. I say I�ve used it. It�s
>more like I�ve tried it. It works but it seems a bit cumbersome. It has
>the advantage of costing a few tens of dollars. There may be some other
>programs out there that are expensive, but the others I know about are
>several hundreds of dollars. The address of FCP is www.high-logic.com.

If you're finding FCP cumbersome, be glad you haven't tried others. :) I've tried FontLab, and it makes FCP look very simple. I'n not familiar with Fontographer or Corel Draw, since, as you've said, they're VERY expensive. FCP is shareware (30-day trial) and usable, and you can't beat the $50, compared to a minimum of $250 for any of the others.

I manage an FCP group here on Yahoo! Groups, for not only the discussion of FCP, but of font creation in general. You may find it at: http://groups.yahoo.com/group/font_creator_program/

D.M.Falk
